intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pallescens subsp. montafonense, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, basal rosette of leaves and yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in meadows and open slopes at high altitudes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species in its native range.
